item.title: Jessica Sanchez talks small groups & message prep
item.description:
Josh Griffin, Doug Fields, and Jessica Sanchez talk about the weirdest prize ever given and so much more. Questions are answered about keeping your senior pastor informed about the amazing things happening in your ministry, getting students excited, and message prep.

Send in your questions to podcast@downloadyouthministry.com

Questions:
7:12 What's the weirdest prize you've ever given away?
10:51 How do I get my senior pastor to hear the amazing things our ministry is doing when people only tell him negative things?

21:18 What's your weekly message prep routine?

item.title: Katie Edwards talks burnout, engaging students, and change
item.description:
Josh Griffin, Doug Fields, and Katie Edwards talk about burnout looks like and how to catch it before it's too late. Questions are answered about engaging distracted boys in youth ministry and implementing change without stirring the pot.

Send in your questions to podcast@downloadyouthministry.com

Questions:
4:39 What is burnout?
14:51 What are your ideas about engaging boys specifically as their attention spans are decreasing?
29:09 What are some ways to implement change in youth ministry without stirring the pot?

item.title: Questions About Senior Pastors
item.description:
Josh Griffin, Doug Fields, and Katie Edwards talk about why Katie never wants to be a senior pastor, how to start off on the right foot with a new senior pastor and more. Doug, Katie, and Josh answer questions from youth pastors from around the world.

Questions:
09:18 Is it more common than not when a new senior pastor comes up youth pastors need to brace themselves?
10:49 What do you think senior leaders are looking for in a youth pastor?
22:52 How do you support your senior pastor?

item.title: Special Edition Download Youth Ministry Podcast: Unbroken: Path to Redemption w/Luke Zamperini
item.description:
unbrokenfilm.com

WHEN THE WAR ENDED, HIS BATTLE BEGAN. Based on Laura Hillenbrand’s bestselling book, UNBROKEN: PATH TO REDEMPTION begins where the hit movie Unbroken concludes, sharing the next amazing chapter of the unbelievable true story of Olympian and World War II hero Louis Zamperini. Haunted by nightmares of his torment, Louie sees himself as anything but a hero. Then, he meets Cynthia, a young woman who captures his eye—and his heart. Louie’s wrathful quest for revenge drives him deeper into despair, putting the couple on the brink of divorce. Until Cynthia experiences Billy Graham’s 1949 Los Angeles Crusade, where she finds faith in God and a renewed commitment to her marriage and her husband. Now, her most fervent prayer is for God to help Louie find the peace and forgiveness he so desperately needs. In theaters September 14, UNBROKEN: PATH TO REDEMPTION brings to life the rest of this powerful real-life story of forgiveness, redemption, and amazing grace.

item.title: Episode 338: The Man Who Saved Camp
item.description: Jeff Bachman, half of the team behind the DYM Podcast Network Show: “What it is, What it Means”, joins us to talk about his weeklong DIY Summer Camp he (an his wife and intern…and parents, volunteers, local youth pastor friends…) pulled off in just 12-hours after his original location was closed due to a forest fire… PLUS the leadership lessons that came from that experience.

item.title: Special Movie Show - Selma
item.description: The unforgettable true story chronicles the tumultuous three-month period in 1965, when Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. led a dangerous campaign to secure equal voting rights in the face of violent opposition. The epic march from Selma to Montgomery culminated in President Johnson signing the Voting Rights Act of 1965, one of the most significant victories for the civil rights movement. Director Ava DuVernay's "Selma" tells the story of how the revered leader and visionary Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr and his brothers and sisters in the movement prompted change that forever altered history.

item.title: Episode 205 - Redefining Success
item.description: In this episode, it seemed like the recurring theme was about how we need to be careful in defining 'success' in youth ministry. Such a great discussion on this important topic. So go be successful and watch this episode!

item.title: Episode 203 - Matt Who?
item.description: Torie Fields (Doug's oldest daughter) got called up to the big leagues to replace the aging and mission-tripping Matt McGill. She shared insights from her experiences completing her first year in youth ministry including details on what its like to work for McGill. Katie dropped some great wisdom (again), Josh dropped some references to www.MoreThanDodgeball.com (cha-ching!), & Doug left everyone speechless after one of his answers. Listen to this episode as we discuss your questions about finances, background checks, flirting volunteers, siblings in small groups, and more!

item.title: Episode 202 - The Pink Ghost
item.description: It just feels like something is missing in this episode, but it takes a while for the YMG team to notice. Matt is away on a mission trip so the three amigos take over without missing a beat (just a few loud cackles). Katie is rested and returns from her vacation to offer up some great youth ministry wisdom - as well as some great sound-bytes as the team takes on a ton of youth ministry questions.

item.title: Episode 201 - Doug's Drinking Habit
item.description: While we were bummed that the Podcast Queen, Katie Edwards, was on a much-needed vacation and couldn't join us for this episode of the YM Garage, we're thrilled to have special guest & former podcast regular Jana Sarti, aka the Squawker,return! Jana shares her insights, Matt brings the funny, Josh agrees with everyone a lot, and Doug explains how his 'drinking habit' first started. That and we answer a lot of questions! Join us as we take our first step to Episode 300.

item.title: Episode 199 - Official Tour of the YM Garage
item.description: For those viewers who have ever doubted if this podcast was taped in an actual garage - doubt no longer friends. You'll get an exclusive all-access tour of the YM Garage. You'll get a behind-the-scenes look at Doug's old office (some might even say "storage closet"). While this is the shortest episode we've ever taped, it's because we've already begun packing for our trip to San Diego for Show 200 LIVE at YS' NYWC! What a milestone - and we couldn't think of a more fitting way to celebrate it than with a few hundred fellow youth workers as our live studio audience. Enjoy the tour!
